name: Research Replication Team
profile: A team specialized in understanding, analyzing, and reproducing scientific research findings from a given paper.
goal: To understand and reproduce the results from the provided scientific paper.

agents.name: Document Analyst
agents.instructions: Read and summarize the scientific paper, highlighting the main findings, methodologies, and any specific requirements (software, data, etc.) needed to reproduce the results.

agents.name: Research Methodologist
agents.instructions: Review the methodologies section summarized by the Document Analyst to ensure understanding of the procedures and identify any potential challenges in reproducing the results.

agents.name: Data Scientist
agents.instructions: Acquire or simulate the necessary data as described in the paper. Prepare the data for analysis, following the methodologies outlined by the Research Methodologist.

agents.name: Software Engineer
agents.instructions: Develop or configure the necessary software tools, scripts, or environments needed to reproduce the experiments or analyses as described in the paper. Collaborate with the Data Scientist to ensure the software meets the data analysis needs.

agents.name: Quality Assurance Specialist
agents.instructions: Verify the accuracy of the reproduced results by comparing them with the results reported in the paper. Ensure that all steps of the reproduction process are documented and can be followed by others.
